"She probably comes down to get something to…", thought Ethan before stopping as he noticed that the sound of footsteps came to fast, as if Lilly was stomping on the ground constantly. Curiosity began to rise within Ethan and he quickly but quietly turned off the light in the kitchen. The footsteps became louder and louder as they reached the stairs. The lights in the entrance went on and Ethan quickly hid behind a wall from which he could peek.

Lilly didn't want to take the chance that Angela knew about the mysterious device that Ethan had uncovered earlier that day. But everything around her was pointing to the fact that something was out of place. Not wanting to take the chance that her former sister had control of the swapplet, Lilly decided to play it safe. "Hey Angela, is Lilly here?" She asked, looking for a reason to see her friend and try to bring everything back to normal. "I need to borrow a book for school." She then looked over at Angela who seemed to be thinking about what to do.

"I don't know, Lilly is busy picking up her toys and I don't want her to be distracted." Angela thought out loud to herself, still thinking that only she and her 'sister' were the only ones to know the power of the swapplet.
"But as long as you don't take too long, it should be fine. I will give you a couple minutes." She moved out of the way and allowed her former sister to get past. As she passed by, Lilly couldn't help but marvel at how much taller she was now compared to her.

"Right" Lilly replied walking up the stairs and noticed the pictures. One had Ethan with Angela's long brown hair tied up in pigtails smiling a huge, toothy grin while holding up a sheet of paper with the logo of the school spelling bee. The next one was of herself and Ethan at a birthday party. He had on a poofy party dress that she'd hadn't worn since she was nine. 'Who knew that my little sister would cause all of this.' She sighed as she walked towards her room and knocked on the door.

"Leave me alone, Angela." Ethan cried out from the other side of the door. Lilly began to open the door and noticed a much shorter Ethan picking up her room. "I'm almost done. Oh my god, Lilly!" Ethan quickly made his way over to his friend and embraced her lovingly. "You shouldn't have come here. Angela found the swapplet and gave me her height and age." He replied looking up at his friend, who now stood 2 feet taller than himself.

"I know, but we need to get it back, do you know what she did with it?" She asked looking for some answers in an attempt to get everything back to normal. She watched Ethan think for a moment.

"The last thing I remember is that she put it up above the cupboards in the kitchen and I can't reach it without help." Ethan chimed in, thinking about a way to get the powerful object back. "And if I use the chairs, she will hear me. And I don't know what else she will do to me." He shuddered thinking about the other possible consequences that he might have to endure.

"Well, you might not be able to reach it, but I might." Lilly replied with a thrust of her chest in pride.

"Yeah, that might just work." Ethan answered back as he brought his long brown hair under control and put it behind his ear. "I can distract her and you can try to get it."

"Here let me grab this book and I will leave." Lilly grabbed a book and explained her plan. Just make sure that the back door is unlocked and I will sneak back in while you keep her busy." Ethan nodded his head as he agreed to the plan.

"Lilly, the pizzas here!" Angela cried out from down stairs. "Ethan, its time for you to go so that we can eat."

Lilly, knowing that it was now time to put their plan into action, without any more planning. "Okay, I'm on my way back down." She cried out to her former sister and her friend's tormentor. She made her way down stairs and Ethan heard the door shut behind her.

"You're pizza is going to get cold." Angela cried out again. Taking a deep breath, Ethan made his way downstairs.

"Good, the door is open and Angela, being the irresponsible little girl she is, has not bothered with closing it", thought Ethan as he made his way to Angela, with a short detour to the backdoor. Angela had made herself comfortable in the living room, sitting on the ground besides the couch table and was already eating her piece of the pizza.

"There you are", she greeted him with a full mouth. "Come on, get your pizza."

Ethan did as he was told, his glance wandered around the room. He could not find the swapplet lying around anywhere near the table, obviously since Angela did not want him to get it back. "But this certainly helps. It's probably still hidden on the kitchen cupboard, which makes it easier for Lilly to find it", he thought as he grabbed a slice.

"How are you enjoying your new height?", asked Ethan and tried to spark a conversation so Angela would not notice Lilly when she came in. The now tall girl was sitting with her back to the kitchen and the backdoor was not visible from the position the two were currently in, but Ethan wanted to be safe than sorry about this.

"It's great", smiled Angela. "I can reach so many places. Your hair is also great, it suits me, right?" She played with a strand of her hair and looked at Ethan. "And not to mention that I am now the older sister. I'll never give that back!" She laughed somewhat maniacally.

"Oh, I don't think so", came a voice from behind her and Angela turned around surprised.

"Ethan?", she asked surprised when suddenly the changes started to happen, and Angela went back to her normal height and lost her red, curly hair in favour for her normal brown hair in pig-tails. It was not apparent, but she also got back her birthday.

"Nooo!", she screamed and jumped up, trying to get to who she thought was Ethan and get the swapplet back from him. Sadly, with her reduced height it was very easy for Lilly to hold the swapplet up high enough so that Angela could not reach it. "Give it back! It is mine!", screamed Angela again and again, tears forming in the corner of her eyes.

Ethan who was glad that he got his height back and somewhat indifferent for getting Lilly's hair back, stood up and walked over to Lilly. "Thanks, you saved me", he said with a smile.

"No problem. I probably saved half the town. This thing is too dangerous to have a 9-year old use it", replied Lilly and looked down at her sister, who had stopped trying to reach the swapplet and resorted to crying. It broke Lilly's heart to see her sister crying, but she knew that the two could not possibly leave the swapplet in her hands.

"You both are so mean", sobbed Angela and hammered on Lilly's legs.

"Stop that, will ya?", she said slightly annoyed to Angela, her sympathy vanished in that instant. She then turned her attention to Ethan. "What do we do now? She knows about the swapplet, she is registered into the device. She'll know every future swap we'll make."

Ethan nodded and crossed his arms in front of his chest, his face changing to a thinking expression. "Nobody would believe her, but we have to keep it out of her reach for sure", he mumbled lost in thoughts. "Since I keep it, it shouldn't be a problem. The device would be in a different house."

This made Angela look up and stop her crying. "What do you mean? You live here", she asked with an occasional swap in between the words.

"Good job telling her", hissed Lilly and then looked over to her sister. "We both swapped lives earlier. I'm actually your sister and this 'girl' over there is actually Ethan."

Angela's eyes went wide in disbelieve. "But you look like Ethan always did!"

"For you, yes. It's the device that does it", she explained but saw that her sister had a hard time wrapping her head around the matter. "I think we should swap back for now, Ethan." Lilly then used the swapplet to reset the life swap that took place between her and Ethan. She soon found herself back in her own clothes, with her own hair.

"So? When are you going to swap back?", asked Angela impatiently.

"We already did", replied Lilly surprised.

"Apparently you only notice resets when you notice the swap", concluded Ethan.

Angela raised an eyebrow and looked at the two. "You're pranking me, right? You two did not swap lives."

Ethan wanted to continue explaining the situation to Angela, but Lilly silenced him by shaking her head. Lilly, being back in her role as the older sister, thought about what to do with Angela now. Should they really withhold the swapplet from her?

"Hey, Ethan", she began. "I've been thinking. Maybe we can let her use the swapplet. Wait, wait! Let me finish. We won't allow her to use it on her own, BUT we could talk to her about what she wanted to swap and then do the swap for her, if we approve it."

"You serious?", asked Ethan and looked at his crush and childhood friend. She did have a point, but he had wanted the swapplet to be a secret between him and her. With the cat out of the bag, it can never be a secret between just the two of them now, but did he really want to share this power with Lilly's sister?

After several minutes of waiting, he finally was able to hear a door close and the toilet seat hitting the back of the commode. He knew that this was his chance, Ethan slowly closed the door and quickly, yet quietly, made his way down stairs. As he made it to the back door, Ethan felt out of breath and realized that he hadn't taken a breath since leaving the room. Slowly he unlocked the back door and quietly made his way outside. The crackling of the grass beneath his feet let him know that he was walking on eggshells with Angela. If he was caught, what would she do to him. He shook his head and felt his new pig tails hit his head. Careful not to get caught, Ethan tried his best to stay out of sight of the windows and finally made his way to the fence. "Lilly." Putting his eye in a knot of one of the boards, Ethan was able to see his friend/crush looking around to see where her 'real' name was being called from. "Over here." Ethan called out with a little more force and sticking his hand through the knot in an attempt to get her attention.

"Ethan?" Lilly cried out and quickly running over to him to talk. "I'm so glad to see you. Angela swapped me with Abbie and now she's you." Ethan could tell that she was on the verge of crying and tried his best to console her but could only do so much through the fence.

"It's alright." Ethan replied though the fence. "From what I saw, she believes that she's me and won't do anything too bad. But as for Angela, what do you think we should do?"

"I...I..." Lilly replied in between sobs. "I don't know. She's so much taller than us now and I don't know what she will do to us." With her diminished height and abruptly switching her life with the little girl next door seemed to be too much for her and she broke down.

"Calm down and think." Ethan consoled, trying to keep a level head. "I think that she will put it down at night and all we have to do is find it, right?"

"I guess, you're right." Lilly acknowledged, having stopped the sobbing and seemingly getting it together. "We need more time to think and make a plan."

"Well, yes and no." Ethan corrected thinking back to the poster of blonde-haired girl with the large pink bow smiling down that was now on Lilly's wall. "I think she swapped out her stuff for yours, or at least that's what I think happened."

"That little..." She bit her tongue before she said something that she would regret. "I swear when I get my hands on her..."

"Hello there." Ethan replied, not really remembering her name and didn't want to be rude.

"Yeah, it's me." Ethan called out making his presence known, or rather the life that he was currently living.

"Yeah, she's doing good." Ethan replied thinking of Lilly's Mom. "She's showing a house right now and won't be back until later."

Alexandra called out to the seemingly empty home. She turned the corner to see Angela sitting on the couch with her feet on the couch watching a movie. "Young lady!" She exclaimed as she put her hands on her hips. "You know better than that?"

Angela quickly turned the channel in an attempt to hide the evidence from her Mom. "Oh hey Mom, you're home early." She turned around to see her Mom with a hint of disappointment on her face.

"How many times do I have to tell you not to put your feet on the sofa?" Alexandra sighed as she picked up Angela's feet and gently tossed them off the couch towards the floor. She then looked over at her and wondering if she knew about her little sister not being here. "How is your little sister doing?"

"Good." Angela quickly replied with a proud tone in her voice, finally being seen as the big sister. "She's up in her room right now."

"Oh really." Alexandra chuckled slightly under her breath. "Then why did I get a phone call from Mrs. Evans asking if Lilly can stay the night?"

"But, I sent her to her room earlier." Angela replied as she quickly got up and soon found herself standing 7 inches taller than her Mom. "That little brat is going to pay." She mumbled under her breath.

"It's all good." Alexandra replied. "You know, I'm actually kind of glad that she's making friends her own age. I mean, I don't know why she's friends with Ethan."

Angela giggled, thinking of Lilly's friend, Ethan, having to live as the 10 year old girl that lived next door. She thought for a moment on whether or not she wanted to punish her sister, but decided against it. She had to come home some time and that's when she would act. "So she's alright?"

"Yeah, she's having a sleep over with Abigail." Alexandra answered. "So if it's just going to be us tonight, how about we go check out a movie and have a night out? I mean, it's been forever since its been just us." Angela, still having the excitement of a 9 year old, jumped at the chance to go somewhere interesting with her Mom. She was so excited that she left the swapplet unattended on the grey sectional that wrapped around the room. The two of them silently made their way out of the house and into the minivan.

Next door sitting in the kitchen, Ethan watched with disbelief as Angela and Mrs. Gordon piling into their minivan and backing out of the driveway. Turning to Lilly, he whispered in her ear. "Your Mom and sister are leaving, so now is our chance to get the swapplet."

"I guess, but how are we going to get inside?" Lilly whispered back, trying not to cause any attention being brought to them.

"But we can still go look to see if we can get in, right?" Ethan suggested with a smirk and a wink.

info.description:
One night, Ethan saw something crashing into his backyard. When he investigated the crash site, he found a strange liquid that changed into a tablet when he touched it. He also gained the knowledge of what it does and how to use it.

Rules:

No killing of the characters
Keep the continuity as consistent as possible
Feel free to add characters if you want
No one liner chapters. Only add a chapter when you want to add to the story and not for the sake of adding a chapter!

Main Characters:

Ethan Harrison (17): 6”1’. Short, blond hair. He has a crush on his childhood friend Lilly but is too shy to tell her. He had always phantasised about wearing women’s clothing or having female body parts.

Lilly Gordon (17): 5”7’. Long, curly, red hair. The hair is dyed, she was originally brown haired. She has a crush on Ethan but is just as shy as he is about that. She likes to dress feminine but is not really into fashion.

Harold Harrison (47): 6”2’. Grey hair. Father of Ethan and Stacy, husband of Susan Anderson and works as an accountant at a big company.

Susan Harrison (43): 5”6’. Long, blond hair. Mother of Ethan and Stacy, wife of Harold Anderson and works as a teacher at a local junior high.

Stacy Harrison (15): 5”8’. Long, blond hair. Ethan’s sister. She loves anime and cosplay and usually watches the former or works on the latter alone in her room.

Alexandra Gordon (51): 5"4'. Short, brown hair. Lilly's and Angela's mother. Works as a real estate agent to provide for her family.

Angela Gordon (9): 3"7'. Long, brown hair. Lilly's younger sister and a typical little girl. Loves dolls and her sister.

Joséphine Dufour (29): 5”7’. Curly, black hair. French teacher at Ethan’s high school. She has a secret relationship with the P.E. teacher Henry Anderson.

Henry Anderson (34): 6”4’. Short, black hair. P.E. teacher at Ethan’s high school. Ex football player that became a teacher due to a shoulder injury. Has a secret relationship with Joséphine Dufour.

Nicole Andrews (17): 5”8’. Shoulder-length brown hair. Lilly’s best female friend and a girly girl through and through. Loves shopping, fashion. Ethan thinks she is annoying.

Kurt Jameson (16): 6”2’. Short, black hair. He is a year under Ethan and reserve player for the football team. Because of his physical strength and his position in the football team, he is a bully even to upperclassmen.

Keith Perry (17): 6"3'. Short, brown hair. Ethan's male best friend. Has a carefree mentality and calls Ethan simply "E". Just like Ethan he has a crush on Lilly but does not pursue it, because he figured out Ethan's crush.

Andrea Jefferson (43): 5"6'. Long, brown hair. A single mother. Her husband left her 6-years ago, presumably to be with another woman. Has a strained relationship with her daughter who blames her for her fathers disappearance. Works as a secretary in the same company as Harold Harrison.

Veronica Jefferson (16): 5"3'. Short, pink hair. A rebellious teen. She blames her mother for her fathers disappearance and rebels against her since then.

Keiko Yamaoka (15): 5". Long, black hair. Shy and clumsy girl. She is usually alone and tries to be very good at school.

The Swapplet
The swapplet, named by Ethan, is an alien device, capable of changing forms to look more comfortable to the user.
The swapplet allows the user to swap everything about himself or other people, while changing reality so that all the swaps are normal. Only people registered in the swapplet will notice any changes done to reality from that point on. They will be oblivious to all swaps made prior.
